Topic: Prisma SD-WAN Virtual Bypass Pair On 3108v

I'm trying to setup branch HA on a couple of 3108v on VMware ESXi. https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-sd-wan/prisma-sd-wan-admin/prisma-sd-wan-sites-and-d...

Topic: Finding a rogue IP in Prisma SD-WAN

Author: Krishnatpi
Topic: Need help to download PA-3020  PAN OS
Body: Recently we  received a Vulnerability which directed us to  upgrade our Palo Alto firewall from 8.1.11 to 8.1.23. But our firewall support is elapsed and our organization planning to move to palo alto cloud but it will take time. since the support is elapsed i am unable to download PAN OS 3020 software though palo alto support portal . I need help & guidance to download the software to upgrade my hardware to the mentioned version. Please help.

Author: benjemaa
Topic: SD-WAN branches not reaching other branches through hub in an mesh VPN cluster
Body: hey guys hello, i successfully implemented an SD-WAN full mesh between 1 hub and 3 branches.each FW has 1 LAN and 2 WANs, WAN1 on ISP1 and WAN2 on ISP2.to test the full mesh connection and force branches to reach each other through the HUB is removed ISP1 on branch 1 and also removed ISP2 on branch 2.i checked the bgp fib on the hub i can find the LANs of branch 1(learned through ISP2 as i removed ISP1) and branch 2(learned from ISP1 as i removed ISP2), the problem is that the hub is not redistributing the routes to both branches the fib of branch 1 don't contain branch 2 networks same for branch 2 fib it doesn't contain branch 1 networks. any idea about this problem ?

Author: AjitKumar
Topic: ION2000 when connected to Internet fails to show up under unclaimed devices on the SD-WAN portal
Body: Here are some of the commnds I ean on ION2K via console: ion toolkit# dump controller status Controller Connection : Partially ConnectedNumber of Active Connections : 1--------------------------------------------------------------------------------tcp 0 0 10.0.0.65:41419 52.8.25.40:443 ESTABLISHED--------------------------------------------------------------------------------==ion toolkit# ping controller 8.8.8.8PING 8.8.8.8 (8.8.8.8) from 10.0.0.65: 56 data bytes64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: seq=0 ttl=117 time=13.652 ms64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: seq=1 ttl=117 time=13.592 ms64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: seq=2 ttl=117 time=14.170 ms64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: seq=3 ttl=117 time=14.148 ms64 bytes from 8.8.8.8: seq=4 ttl=117 time=13.524 ms--- 8.8.8.8 ping statistics ---5 packets transmitted, 5 packets received, 0% packet lossround-trip min/avg/max = 13.524/13.817/14.170 msion toolkit#== Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks,Ajit

Author: jandrews
Topic: Check Out the Prisma SD-WAN (formerly CloudGenix SD-WAN) Getting Started Guide
Body: The Getting Started Guide provides information on setting up, configuring, and monitoring the enterprise wide area network (WAN). It is intended for network administrators and network managers who are responsible for configuring, monitoring, and troubleshooting enterprise WANs.Learn more

Author: jandrews
Topic: Learn More about the Prisma SD-WAN (formerly CloudGenix SD-WAN) Quick Start Guide
Body: The Prisma SD-WAN (formerly CloudGenix) Quick Start Guide provides a quick introduction to getting started with the Prisma SD-WAN solution. For additional information on a particular step, wherever applicable, links to individual User Guides have been provided.Learn more
